bibdata.title: Refactoring code to handle availability information for a given holding.
Add lando tooling to import backup
pickup_location_id should return an id same to what we currently get from voyager
Add tooling to import database backup in lando

comments.body:
For anyone who would like to test this. I have a  `marc_liberation.dump` backup from production in bibdata1. You would need to pull the backup in your local and edit it as described https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata#database-configuration 
`vi marc_liberation.dump`
`:%s/marc_liberation_prod/marc_liberation_dev/g `
`:wq` 
so that the db name in the file changes from marc_liberation_prod to marc_liberation_dev. 

Then I use `lando db-import marc_liberation.dump`. I can see the script loading the backup but it creates an empty database with name `database`. I tried to set the -h flag for an alias of the database name but I'm not able to load it correctly. Any review would be much appreciated. Or if you want feel free to push a commit in this pr.

bibdata.title: Provide detailed availability values at /bibliographic/:id/holding/:id/availability endpoint
Post incremental ReCAP dump files to S3

comments.body:
Leaving some notes here in case I don't finish this in time:

Current way this works (a lot of this is going to end up deleted, and a lot of it is not tested):

1. `marc_liberation:recap_dump` gets called by a rake task which is now deleted (https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/50b293cd5fcdb02ff8716984c6f953c6a24ecc14/lib/tasks/sync.rake#L8-L10)
1. `Dump.dump_ids` called with the dump type `PRINCETON_RECAP` (https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/50b293cd5fcdb02ff8716984c6f953c6a24ecc14/app/models/dump.rb#L51-L53)
1. A `Dump` is created with `update_ids` set to all the updated barcodes from the queries. NO files are created! https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/50b293cd5fcdb02ff8716984c6f953c6a24ecc14/app/models/dump.rb#L99-L104
1. Several slices of dump files are created. These are empty records, no actual file is saved yet. RecapDumpJob is called to generate the actual files associated with those `DumpFile`s: https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/50b293cd5fcdb02ff8716984c6f953c6a24ecc14/app/models/dump.rb#L38-L45
1. Each file which gets created at the DumpFile's path is uploaded to the S3 bucket (https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/50b293cd5fcdb02ff8716984c6f953c6a24ecc14/app/jobs/recap_dump_job.rb#L17-L21). The files are just the default named DumpFile paths, which are named after the generation timestamp.

With the new process:

1. Alma creates incremental ReCAP dumps and fires a message (done)
2. AwsSqsPoller downloads the files, creates a Dump, and a DumpFile for every file that Alma outputs (done)
3. AlmaDumpTransferJob should queue a transfer job for each DumpFile. (Probably a new job - RecapDumpJob no longer applies anymore. It could happen as part of AlmaDumpTransferJob, but I don't want the job to fail because the S3 bucket fails to connect or something.)

To test this we'll have to create an AWS bucket for alma-staging, which may be tough because that's currently set to be a production environment. Probably need some sort of flag for the bucket choice, or add another environment?

Edit: Don't worry about environment, just change the ENV variables in Ansible here: https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/blob/e82313ee67ab3ebe949cdf3fdee1ef1bcd4920ca/group_vars/bibdata/alma_staging.yml#L118-L121

bibdata.title: Clean up dump files on sftp server

comments.body: Normally the way this would get handled is a cron job on `lib-sftp` that just does `find /alma/* -mtime +30 -exec rm {} \;`, but it doesn't look like lib-sftp is handled by ansible. @kayiwa should we add an ansible role that only does that somehow? Or maybe we should just add this to that box?

orangelight.title: Refreshing the alma qa site shows different facet counts

comments.body:
Problem seems to be something with solr replication. If I tunnel to Solr and just run a query from the alias I get three numFound values:

Sometimes it’s 9096261, sometimes it’s 7378437, sometimes it’s 10814756
Appending `shards.info=true` shows smaller numbers for lib-solr6, and that shard's having issues with other collections. We're gonna reboot it.
lib-solr-staging6 threw a disk available error on the 6th, it might just be full.
We deleted a large core that was no longer in use and it freed up 30% of the disk space. Closing.

pulfalight.title: UV issues: not displaying MVWs, information/contents bars properly for some PCs

comments.body:
I will defer to the PO's, but personally think that 1 and 2 are off the table at this point. The presence of the table of contents is necessary for context. In addition, we don't really want to deal with toggling it, especially if expanding the TOC will result in disappearing thumbnails that we can't get back without hiding and refreshing. I am also firmly against changing our entire layout because of a UV bug.

I'm reaching out to the UV folks now. If that seems like a dead end, it may be easier to contribute code to Mirador to improve the MVW experience.
Expanding the ToC won't result in the thumbnails going away forever. The thumbnails re-appear as long as they rendered when the page first loaded.
For me seeing these visually might be the best way for us to determine what does and does not work.

Hiding the ToC will not fix the problem for mobile devices. We need to fix the issue for all users.

There's a UV community call on May 6th, and fixing this bug is likely to be on the agenda. I will confirm when they announce, and I plan to attend.

recap.title: Cache clear capistrano task producing error

comments.body:
Actually, I should also note that, when working directly from `main`, I receive the following error:

```bash
Unable to determine name from existing gemspec. Use :name => 'gemname' in #install_tasks to manually set it.
[...]/vireo_transformation/Rakefile:3:in `require'
```

I assume that this is because the `gemspec` is not included.
